content:
MemberDescriptor Class

Definition

Represents a class member, such as a property or event. This is an abstract base class.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public abstract class MemberDescriptor
Inheritance
System.Object
MemberDescriptor

Inherited Members

Equals(Object,Object)
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

MemberDescriptor is the base class for the EventDescriptor and the PropertyDescriptor classes. The EventDescriptor class provides a description of an event, and the PropertyDescriptor class provides a description of a property.

This class defines properties and methods to access its stored attributes. The Attributes property gets the collection of attributes. The Category, IsBrowsable, Description, and DesignTimeOnly properties retrieve the values of those specific attributes. The Name and DisplayName properties provide the name of the member.

The MemberDescriptor also defines an Equals method to compare this MemberDescriptor to another.

Note

Typically, you inherit from the EventDescriptor and PropertyDescriptor classes, and not from this class.

Constructors

MemberDescriptor(MemberDescriptor)

Initializes a new instance of the MemberDescriptor class with the specified MemberDescriptor.

protected MemberDescriptor (System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor descr);
descr
MemberDescriptor

A MemberDescriptor that contains the name of the member and its attributes.

MemberDescriptor(String)

Initializes a new instance of the MemberDescriptor class with the specified name of the member.

protected MemberDescriptor (string name);
name
String

The name of the member.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The name is an empty string ("") or null.

MemberDescriptor(MemberDescriptor,Attribute[])

Initializes a new instance of the MemberDescriptor class with the name in the specified MemberDescriptor and the attributes in both the old MemberDescriptor and the Attribute array.

protected MemberDescriptor (System.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor oldMemberDescriptor, Attribute[] newAttributes);
oldMemberDescriptor
MemberDescriptor

A MemberDescriptor that has the name of the member and its attributes.

newAttributes
Attribute[]

An array of Attribute objects with the attributes you want to add to the member.

Remarks

This constructor appends the attributes in the Attribute array to the attributes in the old MemberDescriptor.

MemberDescriptor(String,Attribute[])

Initializes a new instance of the MemberDescriptor class with the specified name of the member and an array of attributes.

protected MemberDescriptor (string name, Attribute[] attributes);
name
String

The name of the member.

attributes
Attribute[]

An array of type Attribute that contains the member attributes.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The name is an empty string ("") or null.

Properties

AttributeArray

Gets or sets an array of attributes.

protected virtual Attribute[] AttributeArray { get; set; }
Value
Attribute[]

An array of type Attribute that contains the attributes of this member.

Remarks

Accessing this member allows derived classes to modify the default set of attributes that are used in the CreateAttributeCollection method.

Attributes

Gets the collection of attributes for this member.

public virtual System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection Attributes { get; }
Value
AttributeCollection

An AttributeCollection that provides the attributes for this member, or an empty collection if there are no attributes in the stem.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.AttributeArray*.

Remarks

If there is no AttributeCollection for this member, this property calls the CreateAttributeCollection method to create a new AttributeCollection using the array of Attribute objects passed to the constructor.

Category

Gets the name of the category to which the member belongs, as specified in the CategoryAttribute.

public virtual string Category { get; }
Value
String

The name of the category to which the member belongs. If there is no CategoryAttribute, the category name is set to the default category, Misc.

Remarks

A visual designer can use this property value to display members in categories.

Description

Gets the description of the member, as specified in the DescriptionAttribute.

public virtual string Description { get; }
Value
String

The description of the member. If there is no DescriptionAttribute, the property value is set to the default, which is an empty string ("").

Remarks

A visual designer can use this description to display information about this member.

DesignTimeOnly

Gets whether this member should be set only at design time, as specified in the DesignOnlyAttribute.

public virtual bool DesignTimeOnly { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this member should be set only at design time; false if the member can be set during run time.

Remarks

If there is no DesignOnlyAttribute, the return value is the default, which is false.

DisplayName

Gets the name that can be displayed in a window, such as a Properties window.

public virtual string DisplayName { get; }
Value
String

The name to display for the member.

IsBrowsable

Gets a value indicating whether the member is browsable, as specified in the BrowsableAttribute.

public virtual bool IsBrowsable { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the member is browsable; otherwise, false. If there is no BrowsableAttribute, the property value is set to the default, which is true.

Remarks

A visual designer typically displays the members that are browsable in the Properties window.

Name

Gets the name of the member.

public virtual string Name { get; }
Value
String

The name of the member.

NameHashCode

Gets the hash code for the name of the member, as specified in stem.String.GetHashCode*.

protected virtual int NameHashCode { get; }
Value
Int32

The hash code for the name of the member.

Methods

CreateAttributeCollection()

Creates a collection of attributes using the array of attributes passed to the constructor.

protected virtual System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection CreateAttributeCollection ();
Returns
AttributeCollection

A new AttributeCollection that contains the stem.ComponentModel.MemberDescriptor.AttributeArray* attributes.

Remarks

This method is called from the Attributes property when there is no AttributeCollection for this member. If there are no attributes in the AttributeArray, this will return an empty AttributeCollection.

Equals(Object)

Compares this instance to the given object to see if they are equivalent.

public override bool Equals (object obj);
obj
System.Object

The object to compare to the current instance.

Returns
Boolean

true if equivalent; otherwise, false.

FillAttributes(IList)

When overridden in a derived class, adds the attributes of the inheriting class to the specified list of attributes in the parent class.

protected virtual void FillAttributes (System.Collections.IList attributeList);
attributeList
IList

An IList that lists the attributes in the parent class. Initially, this is empty.

Remarks

For duplicate attributes, the last one added to the list is kept.

The IList with the attributes is created once. If there are duplicate attributes in the list, only the first instance is saved; all subsequent duplicate attributes are removed from the list.

FindMethod(Type,String,Type[],Type)

Finds the given method through reflection, searching only for public methods.

protected static System.Reflection.MethodInfo FindMethod (Type componentClass, string name, Type[] args, Type returnType);
componentClass
Type

The component that contains the method.

name
String

The name of the method to find.

args
Type[]

An array of parameters for the method, used to choose between overloaded methods.

returnType
Type

The type to return for the method.

Returns
MethodInfo

A MethodInfo that represents the method, or null if the method is not found.

FindMethod(Type,String,Type[],Type,Boolean)

Finds the given method through reflection, with an option to search only public methods.

protected static System.Reflection.MethodInfo FindMethod (Type componentClass, string name, Type[] args, Type returnType, bool publicOnly);
componentClass
Type

The component that contains the method.

name
String

The name of the method to find.

args
Type[]

An array of parameters for the method, used to choose between overloaded methods.

returnType
Type

The type to return for the method.

publicOnly
Boolean

Whether to restrict search to public methods.

Returns
MethodInfo

A MethodInfo that represents the method, or null if the method is not found.

GetHashCode()

Returns the hash code for this instance.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

A hash code for the current MemberDescriptor.

GetInvocationTarget(Type,Object)

Retrieves the object that should be used during invocation of members.

protected virtual object GetInvocationTarget (Type type, object instance);
type
Type

The Type of the invocation target.

instance
System.Object

The potential invocation target.

Returns
System.Object

The object to be used during member invocations.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

type or instance is null.

Remarks

Normally, the return value will be the same as the instance parameter. If another object has been associated with this instance, or if the instance is a custom type descriptor, the GetInvocationTarget method may return a different value.

GetInvokee(Type,Object)

Gets the component on which to invoke a method.

protected static object GetInvokee (Type componentClass, object component);
componentClass
Type

A Type representing the type of component this MemberDescriptor is bound to. For example, if this MemberDescriptor describes a property, this parameter should be the class that the property is declared on.

component
System.Object

An instance of the object to call.

Returns
System.Object

An instance of the component to invoke. This method returns a visual designer when the property is attached to a visual designer.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

componentClass or component is null.

GetSite(Object)

Gets a component site for the given component.

protected static System.ComponentModel.ISite GetSite (object component);
component
System.Object

The component for which you want to find a site.

Returns
ISite

The site of the component, or null if a site does not exist.
